Hi there,

I write copy based on traditional direct response principles, and I aim for it to:

  1. Be Tactful - The volume knob on your copy should have more than one knotch. Sometimes going over the top works great. But more often than not, a nuanced approach is key.
  2. Respect Audiences - I want prospects to know I've done everything in my power to grasp and acknowledge who they are, that I'm a trusted ally.
  3. Improve Lives - A tall order, I know. But great copy helps problem-solving products find their way into the hands of prospects who need them. And in that situation, I think everybody wins.

You're probably wondering why I didn't write "results-driven," "high-converting," or something else like that up there.

The reason why is this: I find results come naturally when I combine those three guidelines with the fundamentals of writing great copy.

Here are a few things my clients have said:

"Overall, his final work comes in flawless and prior the scheduled deadline, which certainly makes my job a lot easier." - Joe Hanning, Marketing Manager of UVA Bookstores
"I'm super impressed with Wil's ability to deliver quality copy on time and on budget. He is easy to work with and gets things right the first time (e.g. doesn't require handholding or endless revisions)." - Drew Kossoff, CEO of Rainmaker Ad Ventures
"Writing for different industries is always a challenge, but he’s been able to quickly adapt to each client’s unique voice and industry jargon and always delivers great copy that requires minimal (if any) editing." - Chris Dodds, Cloud Architect

Do you already have established offers, traffic sources, and email lists, but just need a reliable copywriter to help execute your ongoing workload?

I work exclusively with people like you.

Use the form below to tell me about your project.

Cheers,
Wil
